official-title.#text:
To provide for the conveyance of certain land inholdings
		  owned by the United States to the Pascua Yaqui Tribe of Arizona, and for other
		  purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Pascua Yaqui Tribe Trust Land
			 Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

For the purposes of this Act, the following
			 definitions apply:

term.#tail:
means the Tucson Unified School District, a school
			 district recognized as such under the laws of the State of Arizona.

means the Pascua Yaqui Tribe of Arizona, a federally
			 recognized Indian tribe.

			 in trust

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
An Act to authorize the leasing of restricted Indian lands for public,
			 religious, educational, recreational, residential, business, and other purposes
			 requiring the grant of long-term leases
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: An Act to authorize the leasing of restricted Indian lands for public, religious, educational, recreational, residential, business, and other purposes requiring the grant of long-term leases

text.#text:
The Tribe may not
			 conduct gaming activities on the lands held in trust under this Act, as a
			 matter of claimed inherent authority, or under the authority of any Federal
			 law, including the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or
			 under any regulations thereunder promulgated by the

text.#text:
There shall not be Federal reserved rights to surface
			 water or groundwater for any land taken into trust by the United States for the
			 benefit of the Tribe under this Act.

The Tribe retains any right or claim to water under State
			 law for any land taken into trust by the United States for the benefit of the
			 Tribe under this Act.

Any water rights that are appurtenant to land taken
			 into trust by the United States for the benefit of the Tribe under this Act may
			 not be forfeited or abandoned.

Nothing
			 in this Act affects or modifies any right of the Tribe or any obligation of the
